titles.title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 744 West Oglethorpe Highway in Hinesville, Georgia, as the "John Sidney 'Sid' Flowers Post Office Building".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Mr. Davis (IL) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3470.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.
Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 12/26/2007--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Designates the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 744 West Oglethorpe Highway in Hinesville, Georgia, as the "John Sidney 'Sid' Flowers Post Office Building."
